p: Several single-arm prospective studies looked at the use of WBRT+SIB or HA-SIB-WBRT in variable patient cohorts with SIB doses of 40–52.5Gy in 10–15 fractions [ 10– 15]. The reported intracranial PFS was noted to be as high as 13.5 months with few ≥Grade 3 toxicities (≤6.5%), making it a potentially viable option. In a propensity score-matched comparison against WBRT, Popp et al. reported significantly improved local tumour control rates, intracranial PFS, reduction in neurological deaths and even better OS [ 12]. This has led the group to continue to a phase II HIPPORAD Trial comparing HA-WBRT+SIB against WBRT+SIB (German Clinical Trials Registry: DRKS00004598) [ 16].
